result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell L Servant

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Defendant Mitchell L Servant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert Gardner appears for defendant.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Mitchell L Servant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions regarding non-representation. Court will proceed with the option of having the matter reheard.  Investigator Sergeant John Matthews is sworn and questioned by Attorney Oswald. Testifies to making a traffic stop on defendant's vehicle. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies that a K9 sniff was conducted. Testifies to what was found in the vehicle.  Testifies the substances tested positive for methamphetamine.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. $2500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety.

1:48 PM Defendant Mitchell L Servant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Laura Federico in court for Mitchell L Servant. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment.
